claim.body:
an order from an object side to an image side: a first lens unit having positive refractive power; a second lens unit having negative refractive power; a third lens unit having positive refractive power; a fourth lens unit having negative refractive power; and a fifth lens unit having positive refractive power, wherein: in zooming from a wide angle end to a telephoto end, the first lens unit, the second lens unit, the third lens unit, and the fourth lens unit move so that an interval between the first lens unit and the second lens unit is larger at the telephoto end than that at the wide angle end, an interval between the second lens unit and the third lens unit is smaller at the telephoto end than that at the wide angle end, and an interval between the third lens unit and the fourth lens unit varies; and the following conditional expressions are satisfied:
10.0<f 1/ fw<23.0; and
0.35<f 1/ ft≦ 0.647,
where f1 denotes a focal length of the first lens unit, and fw and ft denote focal lengths of an entire system at the wide angle end and at the telephoto end, respectively.
claim.claim-text: where f1 denotes a focal length of the first lens unit, and fw and ft denote focal lengths of an entire system at the wide angle end and at the telephoto end, respectively.

claim.body:
the following conditional expression is satisfied:
5.0<f 5/ fw<15.0,
where f5 denotes a focal length of the fifth lens unit.
claim.claim-text:

the following conditional expression is satisfied:

claim.body:
the first lens unit moves along a locus convex toward an image plane in zooming; and the following conditional expression is satisfied:
0.05<m 1mid/| m 1|<0.60,
where m1 denotes a movement amount of the first lens unit accompanying the zooming from the wide angle end to the telephoto end, and m1mid denotes a movement amount of the first lens unit from the wide angle end to a zoom position where the first lens unit is positioned closest to the image plane.
claim.claim-text:
6. A zoom lens system according to claim 1 , wherein: the first lens unit moves along a locus convex toward an image plane in zooming; and the following conditional expression is satisfied:
0.05<m 1mid/| m 1|<0.60,

where m1 denotes a movement amount of the first lens unit accompanying the zooming from the wide angle end to the telephoto end, and m1mid denotes a movement amount of the first lens unit from the wide angle end to a zoom position where the first lens unit is positioned closest to the image plane.

claim.body: an aperture stop disposed between the second lens unit and the third lens unit, wherein the aperture stop moves along a locus different from a locus of the third lens unit in zooming.
claim.claim-text: 7. A zoom lens system according to claim 1 , further comprising an aperture stop disposed between the second lens unit and the third lens unit, wherein the aperture stop moves along a locus different from a locus of the third lens unit in zooming.

claim.body: which forms an image on a solid-state image pickup element.
claim.claim-text: 17. A zoom lens system according to claim 1 , which forms an image on a solid-state image pickup element.

claim.body:
a zoom lens system; and a solid-state image pickup element which receives an image of light formed by the zoom lens system, wherein the zoom lens system is comprised of, in an order from an object side to an image side: a first lens unit having positive refractive power; a second lens unit having negative refractive power; a third lens unit having positive refractive power; a fourth lens unit having negative refractive power; and a fifth lens unit having positive refractive power, wherein: in zooming from a wide angle end to a telephoto end, the first lens unit, the second lens unit, the third lens unit, and the fourth lens unit move so that an interval between the first lens unit and the second lens unit is larger at the telephoto end than that at the wide angle end, an interval between the second lens unit and the third lens unit is smaller at the telephoto end than that at the wide angle end, and an interval between the third lens unit and the fourth lens unit varies; and the following conditional expressions are satisfied:
10.0<f 1/ fw<23.0; and
0.35<f 1/ ft≦ 0.647,
where f1 denotes a focal length of the first lens unit, and fw and ft denote focal lengths of an entire system at the wide angle end and at the telephoto end, respectively.
claim.claim-text:
18. An image pickup apparatus, comprising: a zoom lens system; and a solid-state image pickup element which receives an image of light formed by the zoom lens system, wherein the zoom lens system is comprised of, in an order from an object side to an image side: a first lens unit having positive refractive power; a second lens unit having negative refractive power; a third lens unit having positive refractive power; a fourth lens unit having negative refractive power; and a fifth lens unit having positive refractive power, wherein: in zooming from a wide angle end to a telephoto end, the first lens unit, the second lens unit, the third lens unit, and the fourth lens unit move so that an interval between the first lens unit and the second lens unit is larger at the telephoto end than that at the wide angle end, an interval between the second lens unit and the third lens unit is smaller at the telephoto end than that at the wide angle end, and an interval between the third lens unit and the fourth lens unit varies; and the following conditional expressions are satisfied:
10.0<f 1/ fw<23.0; and
0.35<f 1/ ft≦ 0.647,
where f1 denotes a focal length of the first lens unit, and fw and ft denote focal lengths of an entire system at the wide angle end and at the telephoto end, respectively.

where f1 denotes a focal length of the first lens unit, fw and ft denote focal lengths of an entire system at the wide angle end and at the telephoto end, respectively, m1 and m3 denote movement amounts of the first lens unit and the third lens unit accompanying zooming from the wide angle end to the telephoto end, respectively, β2w and β2t denote lateral magnifications of the second lens unit at the wide angle end and at the telephoto end, respectively, and β3w and β3t denote lateral magnifications of the third lens unit at the wide angle end and at the telephoto end, respectively.

where f1 denotes a focal length of the first lens unit, fw and ft denote focal lengths of an entire system at the wide angle end and at the telephoto end, respectively, m1 and m3 denote movement amounts of the first lens unit and the third lens unit accompanying zooming from the wide angle end to the telephoto end, respectively, β2w and β2t denote lateral magnifications of the second lens unit at the wide angle end and at the telephoto end, respectively, and β3w and β3t denote lateral magnifications of the third lens unit at the wide angle end and at the telephoto end, respectively.
